Belmont University
Temporary Adjunct Instructor, Spring 2015
Introduction to Sociology
Substituted for a full time faculty member on emergency leave, prepared lectures on assigned
readings in three sections of Introduction to Sociology for period of two weeks
Adjunct Instructor
Introduction to Sociology, Fall 2011
Created syllabus and instructed 30 undergraduate students using participatory lectures and small
group exercises
Vanderbilt University

Teaching Assistant for:
Health and the Environment, Sociological Perspectives (Social Theory), Social Issues in
Globalization, U.S. Social Movements, Social Problems, American Society, Introduction to Sociology
Teaching Assistant responsibilities included holding office hours to assist students one-on-one
or in small groups; grading papers, exams, quizzes and homework; crafting assignment and
evaluation materials; guest lecturing; leading exam review sessions; providing feedback and progress
reports to students; attending class; monitoring grade distributions and reporting deficiency.
Teaching Trainings and Certification
Graduate Teaching Certificate, a three-phased certification program, Vanderbilt University
Center for Teaching, 2012
Teaching Workshop, a semester course on teaching sociology, 2009
Teaching Assistant Orientation and Training, Vanderbilt University, 2007
RESEARCH EXPERIENCE
Postdoctoral:
State Level Energy Policy Research: PI-David Hess. Conducted semi-structured telephone interviews
with state legislators in 12 U.S. states on the grounds for bipartisan collaboration on green energy
policy. Supervised undergraduate research assistants gathering quantitative data.
Dissertation:
Environmental Civil Society around Lake Baikal: PI-Kate Pride Brown. Performed 10 months of
ethnographic field research in Irkutsk, Russia. Conducted 52 semi-structured interviews with key
stakeholders. Some archival research.
Master’s:
Environmental Activism and Corruption: PI-Kate Pride Brown. Two months of ethnographic field
research in Samara, Russia. Conducted 22 semi-structured interviews.
Other Research:
Digital Memory of the U.S. National Guard: PI-Kate Pride Brown. Gathered textual histories of the
National Guard on state unit websites. Performed content analysis.
Soviet Memory in Contemporary Russia: PI-Kate Pride Brown. Interviews on memories and
perceptions of the Soviet Union with various age cohorts in St. Petersburg and Yoshkar-Ola, Russia.
Death Penalty as a Critical Event: PI-Richard Pride. Collected the population of newspaper articles on
the resumption of execution in Nashville, Tennessee. Performed content analysis.

Other Contributions
US Program Coordinator for the Eurasia Foundation SEE Program – Migration Working Group
Developed list of nonprofit organizations working with immigrants in Chicago, Washington
D.C., and Nashville, Tenn; contacted them with interview requests; scheduled interviews with
SEE Fellows; helped develop focus groups with immigrants; conducted follow-up survey with
area nonprofits.
Contributor to Oxford Analytica
Provided research briefs on topics related to environmental issues in the CIS region
